discussion.author: Zimmi48
discussion.comment:
@herbelin CI shows a compatibility issue with Coq dev (BTW, we were not testing 8.10 nor 8.11, should we add this?)
Do you want me to open a similar issue to coq-community/manifesto#104 for qarith-stern-brocot and bertrand?

discussion.author: Zimmi48
discussion.comment: I've fixed CI for this PR by restraining which versions are tested.

discussion.author: Zimmi48
discussion.comment:
Adding notes to the release on GitHub is not required, but would ensure that it is properly displayed when going to the release page. You can do so by going there: https://github.com/coq-community/qarith-stern-brocot/releases/new?tag=v8.10.0

In any case, this is independent of publishing to opam, which either you or @palmskog could take care of.

discussion.author: herbelin
discussion.comment:
> You can do so by going there: https://github.com/coq-community/qarith-stern-brocot/releases/new?tag=v8.10.0

Is there a way to let this link be managed in batch mode by a script?

discussion.author: Zimmi48
discussion.comment: We don't have any such script right now but it could be possible in theory. In fact, we are mostly waiting on Coq packages starting to migrate to Dune (when the Coq support gets good enough) so that we can use dune-release to manage the release steps. AFAIU dune-release is able to do the GitHub release creation step (as well as opening a PR in the opam repository).

discussion.author: palmskog
discussion.comment: I annotated the release on GitHub.

discussion.author: Zimmi48
discussion.comment: Should this issue be closed now?

discussion.author: herbelin
discussion.comment: @palmskog : Thanks a lot. @zimmi48: indeed closing then, thanks for hints.

discussion.author: Zimmi48
discussion.comment:
Note that because it is running on the new https://travis-ci.com, and not https://travis-ci.org, like Coq, you have access to a detailed reporting in the "Checks" tab.

The builds completed in only 3 minutes, and the detailed report shows a failure with master. The removing of the `fourier` tactic in favor of `lra`, even with a compatibility layer, wasn't without introducing incompatibilities.

I'll try to fix this to get a fully green CI.

discussion.author: herbelin
discussion.comment: @Zimmi48: Tell me what I shall be supposed to do. A priori, I'm waiting for a green CI, right?

discussion.author: Zimmi48
discussion.comment: Indeed. The CI is green already so it's ready to merge.

discussion.author: Zimmi48
discussion.comment: I've just set up "cron jobs", which means that there will be a Travis run every day and this should ensure to catch compatibility problems early. I don't know who will be alerted in case of failure though, maybe the author of the last commit (you)...

discussion.author: herbelin
discussion.comment:
It is only about deprecated names in the arithmetic libraries, and about `fix` which shall expect a name, right?

Perfect to me.

Can it be tagged as 8.8 compatible at the same time?

discussion.author: Zimmi48
discussion.comment: Right. The real fix is about fix. I haven't tested it but it should be 8.8-compatible (and probably with even earlier versions).

discussion.author: Zimmi48
discussion.comment: For the record, I have a branch on top of this one adding CI and I can confirm that the version is this PR is compatible with Coq 8.7-8.9 and not with Coq 8.6 (but that was not changed by this PR). The READMEÂ should probably be updated to reflect this.

discussion.author: Zimmi48
discussion.comment: @herbelin You are the maintainer here. I'm not going to merge this PR myself.
